timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from linkedin/master

Pull latest

timeline.bodyText: Please add a private ctor
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Pool size is too generous, especially if we consider what these threads are used for; they're only meant for fairly rapid checks. The thread pool queues work if no thread is idle. I'd say give it a modest value (e.g. 4).
timeline.author: ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather disallow null futureToAwait
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
This comment is purely about naming.

I think it'd be better to rename futureToAwait to just future
If you decide to go with an implementation that propagates back the future's result, I'd consider giving the method a different name, one that reflects that it is meant to get the future's result (if possible) after a specific duration (e.g. getIfDoneOrCancel?)
timeout is a misleading name for that param cause it implies we may check/finish sooner. We need a name that conveys that this is how much we'll wait (should we call it after?)
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
The javadocs can be improved for greater accuracy so users don't have to grok the code themselves.

The description can be something like:

/**
 * Check if {@code future} is done after {@code timeout} ... (and the rest of the story)

Future to complete/stop - check/cancel?
before aborting future - before checking actually
We'd need to document when and how the returned future is completed successfully, completed w/ an exception, or cancelled.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Change to false; true makes little sense for CompletableFuture
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: nit: inline
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: nit: invert if/else for simplicity
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Does completing a null future immediately make sense semantically?
timeline.author: jzakaryan

timeline.bodyText: One drawback of this is that the user of this API will have to wait for the duration of timeout even if the future completes quickly. I think the version I had in the other PR was taking care of that by creating a separate timeout future and composing it with the provided one. I don't know whether this optimization is important for your use case but we may want to have that if it's a general purpose util.
timeline.author: jzakaryan

replies.bodyText: True. The problem here's there's no easy way to compose that separate timeout future with the provided Future since it's not a CompletableFuture.
replies.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: It would be useful to give this executor a thread factory so we can give its threads meaningful names.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: You don't have to declare throws for runtime exceptions
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of creating/throwing an exception yourself, you can use Objects.requireNonNull() or org.apache.commons.lang3.Validate.notNull().
You need to null-check after as well
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Not needed. We typically throw NullPointerException for null args.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Best practice nit: this would entail adding a dependency on Guava under project(':datastream-utils') { in build.gradle.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
nit: rename expectedException to expectException, isExceptionExpected, shouldThrow ... etc.
timeout can be of type Duration
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: We need to assert the state and value of the returned future as well.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: nit: exceptionThrown?
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: @Test
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
lightweight
"if future was done before after the specified {@code after} elapsed"
"if +the thread retrieving the result of+ the future was interrupted "
"completed exceptionally with the exception thrown by future's computation if it threw one"
"if future's computation was cancelled before it completed normally"
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: Copyright need to be updated.
timeline.author: vishwajith-s
